author: Staff Reporter
text:
Scores of people participated in a mini-marathon organised by DCW as part of its 58th Foundation Day at Sahupuram.

While the male event was flagged off by Orlando Rayan, former football player, Alphonsa Rayan, Officer, Chennai Port Trust Officer, flagged off the female event.

According to a statement, the 12-km-long event started from the company’s main gate and ended at the starting point en route Arumuganeri, Jain Nagar, Peyanvilai, Rathinapuri and Kayalpattinam.

E. Suresh of Sivakasi Ayya Nadar Janaki Ammal College won the first prize by covering the distance in 40.03 minutes and S. Ramamoorthi, student of Tamil Nadu Sports University secured the second place in 40.13 minutes in the male category.

K. Jeyabarathi of Kattunayakanpatti Natraj Higher Secondary School won the female event by completing the race in 48.18 minutes and P. Muthumari of Saratha College for Women, Tirunelveli, secured the second place by completing the race in 50.12 minutes.

At the valedictory function, prizes were given to the winners. Besides, saplings were distributed to all participants in the marathon race.
title: Mini-marathon held
